Package com.xebisco.yield

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebisco.yield.RelativeFile
      • com.xebisco.yield.Texture
  • public class Texture
extends RelativeFile
    A Texture is an image for a game, can be added to entities to display images with a help of the sprite component.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Texture​(RelativeFile relativeFile)  
      Texture​(java.lang.String relativePath)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Clear the texture by setting all pixels to transparent black.
      Texture cut​(Vector2 pos, Vector2 size)
      This function cuts a part of the current texture and returns it as a new texture.
      Texture get()
      This function returns a duplicate of the texture.
      Color getColor​(Vector2 pos)
      This function returns the color of the pixel at the given position.
      Color[][] getColors()
      This function returns a 2D array of colors that represents the texture.
      YldFilter getFilter()
      Returns the filter used by this Texture

      Returns the height of the texture.

      This function returns the invertedX variable.

      This function returns the number of textures that have been loaded.

      This function returns the visualUtils object.
      int getWidth()
      Get the width of the texture.
      void processFilters()
      For each pixel, apply the filter, then make sure the pixel's new location is within the bounds of the image.

      This function takes a texture and returns a new texture that is the same as the original texture, but scaled to the specified size.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Texture get()
        This function returns a duplicate of the texture.
        Returns:
        A duplicate of the texture.

      • updatePixels

        public void updatePixels()
        It takes the texture of the sprite, converts it into a 2D array of pixels and instantiate all pixel objects.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the texture by setting all pixels to transparent black.

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(Color color,
                     Vector2 pos)
        Set the color of the pixel at the given position to the given color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color you want to set the pixel to.
        pos - The position of the pixel to set.

      • setColors

        public void setColors​(Color[][] colors)
        Set the colors of the texture to the given 2D array of colors.
        Parameters:
        colors - The 2D array of colors to set the texture to.

      • getColor

        public Color getColor​(Vector2 pos)
        This function returns the color of the pixel at the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the pixel you want to get the color of.
        Returns:
        A color object.

      • getColors

        public Color[][] getColors()
        This function returns a 2D array of colors that represents the texture.
        Returns:
        The colors of the texture.

      • cut

        public Texture cut​(Vector2 pos,
                   Vector2 size)
        This function cuts a part of the current texture and returns it as a new texture.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the top left corner of the texture to cut out.
        size - The size of the texture to be cut.
        Returns:
        A new Texture object.

      • scale

        public Texture scale​(Vector2 size)
        This function takes a texture and returns a new texture that is the same as the original texture, but scaled to the specified size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to scale the texture to.
        Returns:
        A new texture that is the same as the original texture, but scaled to the size specified.

      • processFilters

        public void processFilters()
        For each pixel, apply the filter, then make sure the pixel's new location is within the bounds of the image.

      • getFilter

        public YldFilter getFilter()
        Returns the filter used by this Texture
        Returns:
        The filter object.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter​(YldFilter filter)
        This function sets the filter to the filter passed in.
        Parameters:
        filter - The filter to use for the query.

      • getTextures

        public static int getTextures()
        This function returns the number of textures that have been loaded.
        Returns:
        The number of textures.

      • setTextures

        public static void setTextures​(int textures)
        This function sets the value of the static variable textures to the value of the parameter textures.
        Parameters:
        textures - The number of textures to be loaded.

      • getTextureID

        public int getTextureID()
        This function returns the texture ID of the texture.
        Returns:
        The textureID is being returned.

        This function returns the invertedX variable.
        Returns:

      • setInvertedX

        public void setInvertedX​(Texture invertedX)
        This function sets the invertedX variable to the value of the invertedX parameter.
        Parameters:
        invertedX - The texture that will be used for the inverted X axis.

        Parameters:
        invertedY - The texture that will be used for the inverted Y axis.

      • getInvertedXY

        public Texture getInvertedXY()
        This function returns the invertedXY texture.
        Returns:
        The texture inverted in the X axis and in the Y axis.

      • setInvertedXY

        public void setInvertedXY​(Texture invertedXY)
        This function sets the invertedXY variable to the value of the invertedXY parameter.
        Parameters:
        invertedXY - The texture that will be used for the inverted XY axis.

      • getPixels

        This function returns the pixels array.
        Returns:
        The pixels array.

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels​(Pixel[][] pixels)
        This function sets the pixels of the image to the pixels passed in as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        pixels - The 2D array of pixels that make up the image.
